text: The Maserati GranTurismo/GranCabrio is a 2-door 2+2 luxury coup√© built by the Italian luxury car brand Maserati. The GranTurismo has six generations. The GranTurismo was first shown at the 2007 Geneva Motor Show in Geneva. ==First generation== The GranTurismo (codenamed M145) was first shown at the 2007 Geneva Motor Show in Geneva. It was released on 2007 for the 2008 model year and was discontinued in December 2019, maintaining its Italian style and design for 12 whole years. It has a unique style for a luxury coupe. Though it was discontinued in 2019, it came back in 2023. ===Convertible version=== The cabriolet version, called the GranCabrio is basically a convertible version of the GranTurismo. It keeps the 4-seat design of the GranTurismo, and is also called 'GranTurismo Convertible' in the US and Canada. ==Second generation== The second generation (codenamed M189) was revealed in late 2022. It is still a 4-seater, but the convertible version was revealed months after the GranTurismo. Back after 4 years, its range includes three trims: 2 petrol Modena and Trofeo, and 1 fully-electric Folgore. It is larger than the previous model ==Other websites== *Maserati GranTurismo at Maserati.com Category:Maserati automobiles Category:Coupes Category:2000s automobiles Category:2010s automobiles Category:2020s automobiles
title: Maserati GranTurismo
